questions.question:
Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.1):


Fig. 1. Circuit configuration of boost converter.


1. What is the use of Boost converter?

answers.a: To convert the AC input voltage to DC output voltage.
answers.b: To convert the DC input voltage to AC output voltage.
answers.c: To step-down the DC input voltage.
answers.d: To step-up the DC input voltage.

explanations.d: Explanation 4: The boost converter is used to steps up the input voltage to higher output voltage

questions.question: 2. Voltage conversion ratio of boost converter is given by:

explanations.c: Explanation 3: Applying volt-sec balance to inductor gives the  (D(V<sub>in</sub>)+(1-D)(V<sub>in</sub>-V<sub>0</sub>)=0) gives voltage gain expression as: 1/(1-D)

questions.question: 3. Which of the following element cannot be used as switch (Sw) in boost converter?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: Diode is an uncontrolled device which cannot be turned-OFF as per the control requirement.

questions.question: 4. What is the relationship between load current (I<sub>0</sub>) and average source current (I<sub>in</sub>) of a boost converter if voltage gain is “M” ?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: Using voltage gain and power balance the average source current can easily be obtained as: I<sub>in</sub>= M I<sub>0</sub>

questions.question: 5. What will be the effect of reversing the diode terminals in Boost converter?

answers.a: Converter will step down the input voltage
answers.b: Converter will not work at all
answers.c: It will work as a boost converter with inverted load voltage polarity.
answers.d: Converter will step up the input voltage

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Under switch-OFF condition the diode gets forward biased and conducts however if its direction is reversed it will remain reverse biased and not conduct.
